result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:56 PM (64-06) Defendant Brett M Lepkowski in court.  Attorney John M. Murphy in court for Brett M Lepkowski.  Attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 

Arraignment held in open court.
Defense acknowledged receipt of the information, waived reading and plead not guilty on all charges on behalf of his client.

Bond Motion Held - Requesting bond be amended to no violent contact with victims. Letter was filed July 6th, proof of counseling. 
Response by the State and accepts letter of proof.
Victim in court and made a statement.

*AMEND BOND - NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH K.U. All other conditions remain.
Arraignment scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Letter dated July 5, 2022, from Jennifer Williams of Associates in Psychotherapy LLC

11:02am Court in session

Defendant Brett Lepkowski present in court with attorney John Murphy. ADA Samuel Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter before the court is a motion to address bond conditions. 
Victim is present asking that the no contact be lifted. 
Matter was on yesterday, there was another ex-wife, Faith Dillinger fka Lepkowski, of Deft who was objecting to contact with her minor child, she was not able to be present today.
Atty Mark Sostarich present in court & represents Faith Dillinger fka Lepkowski
State is objecting to amending the no contact. 
Record by Atty Sostarich, there is a placement order in the family case, further record as to concerns that Ms. Lepkowski has regarding that placement. 
Argument & further record by ADA Berg.
State is asking that Deft participate in counseling prior to lifting the no contact 
Argument by Atty Murphy.
Statement made by Victim, K.U. 
Further record by ADA Berg. 

Court makes record & finding. 
Court would like to see that Deft is participating in counseling. 

Court asks that if Deft is bound over at the preliminary hearing on 7/8 that arraignment be set for 7/13 before Branch I

11:23am Court in recess

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brett M Lepkowski in court.  Attorney John M. Murphy in court for Brett M Lepkowski. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Murphy. State objects. Victim present and is asking for contact. Defendant's ex-wife in court and makes record regarding her concerns. Argument, bond remains. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Rights given and hearing requested. Time period waived. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defense Motion to Amend Bond
John M Murphy

Adjustment Number: 22A 196365,
Payable Number: 265186,
Receipt Number: 22R 011604,
Amount: $20.00
Victim's request to lift the no contact.
Defendant's request to drop the no contact order. Control plan filed.
Signed bond filed with the court.

*AMENDMENT: NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH K.U. dob 7-21-1996 or RESIDENCE. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. 

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH K.U. dob 7-21-1996 OR RESIDENCE. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 

22-2634 thru 2637
